page.title: 08SOCIAL CONCERNS.
page.content: Marston Magna has disadvantages for old and young.There are no youth clubs except the church choir which meets on a Friday night for practices,a Sunday school or a recently built recreation ground.There used to be a village youth club but gradually fewer and fewer people came so the club stopped. Now people go to Rimpton youth club. As there is no school, childrens' parents have to pay for them to be taken to school in a bus to Queen Camel, a distance of about two miles or they have to take them by car. For older children the nearest school is at Castle Cary which is a distance of eight miles. A disadvantage for old people is that there are no shops in the village.Only bread,milk and papers are delivered if ordered.Most people go to Yeovil for their shopping.
